methodology_note: Bullish and bearish scores blend qualitative assessments with disclosed deal sizing across clusters. The sustainability index (NSI) equals 50 + 0.5 × (Bullish − Bearish) and is clamped between 0 and 100.

clusters.name: AI Capex and Capacity
rationale: TeraWulf and Fluidstack announced a 168 MW joint venture backed by a 25-year, $9.5 B hosting contract, adding durable revenue visibility.
Self-financed equipment plans at Hon Hai support incremental supply but lack confirmed customers.

clusters.name: Power Grid & Energy
rationale: New Texas hosting campus still requires project financing closure before construction begins.
Large-scale procurement programmes in Taiwan raise questions about local grid resilience.
sources: Taiwan Ministry of Economic Affairs filings (Oct 2025)

clusters.name: Semiconductor Supply
rationale: Joint ventures diversify accelerator sourcing away from Nvidia.
Supply-demand balance remains tight pending 2026 wafer expansions.

clusters.name: Unit Economics & Efficiency
rationale: Long-term hosting contracts stabilise cash flows for providers like TeraWulf.
Self-funded builds still require high upfront investment before revenue ramps.

clusters.name: Enterprise Demand
rationale: Hyperscalers are locking multi-year capacity via hosted infrastructure.
End-customer visibility remains limited for new Taiwan equipment builds.

clusters.name: Policy & Geopolitics
rationale: No material policy changes reported this week.
Taiwan regulatory approvals still pending for large AI infrastructure plans.

events_update.title: TeraWulf and Fluidstack launch 168 MW AI compute JV
events_update.rationale: A 25-year, $9.5 B hosting contract underpins a 168 MW campus in Abernathy, Texas, contingent on project financing close in 2026.

brief.title: TeraWulf secures $9.5 B hosted AI contract
brief.content: TeraWulf and Fluidstack formed a joint venture for a 168 MW Texas campus backed by a 25-year hosting agreement worth about $9.5 billion. Financial close is slated for 2026, with delivery beginning in the second half of the year.

events_update.title: Hon Hai commits NT$42 B for AI compute equipment
events_update.rationale: Hon Hai will self-finance up to NT$42 B (~$1.37 B) of AI equipment through 2026 without disclosing end customers, adding supply but elevating utilisation risk.

brief.title: Hon Hai funds $1.37 B AI equipment programme
brief.content: Hon Hai outlined a self-financed capex plan of roughly NT$42 billion for AI compute clusters starting December 2025 and running through late 2026. Customer visibility remains limited pending contract announcements.

ccr.note: Capital coverage dips as new self-financed builds proceed ahead of customer commitments.

psr.note: Texas and Taiwan builds still depend on grid upgrades and financing close.

fh.note: Extended hosting contracts cap returns until utilisation ramps.

post.title: AI Sustainability Monitor Daily Brief — Hosted compute builds stack up
post.content:
Daily Brief

TeraWulf’s Fluidstack joint venture added a 25-year, $9.5 billion contract to the pipeline while Hon Hai committed fresh capex for AI hardware. The announcements keep capex elevated but leave execution tied to financing close and end-customer demand.

Overall conditions stay in watch territory as grid and utilisation risks offset the bullish momentum from new hosted compute deals.

new_items.title: 168 MW AI Compute Joint Venture at Abernathy, Texas with ~$9.5 billion 25-year contract
new_items.terms: 25-year hosting agreement worth approximately $9.5 billion with deliveries beginning in H2 2026
new_items.accounting_notes: Hosting lease commitment; delivery H2 2026; project-financed; no supplier equity or warrants disclosed

new_items.title: Up to NT$42b (~US$1.37b) self-financed equipment investment for AI compute cluster/supercomputing centre
new_items.terms: Capital programme running December 2025 through December 2026 funded from internal cash
new_items.accounting_notes: Capex plan disclosed; no contract with third-party hosting or lease specified

reevaluated_items.notes: Financing progress unchanged; awaiting interconnect updates
Lease terms stable; monitoring construction milestones
No new filings; power sourcing unchanged
Programme scope steady; tracking manufacturing roadmap
Monitoring execution on multi-site power agreements
